GDI+ refused to load image. Dropping back to internal routines and trying again

%1 save failed (FreeImage_SaveEx silent fail). Please report this error using Help -> Submit Bug Report.
%1 save failed (FreeImage returned blank handle). Please report this error using Help -> Submit Bug Report.

The FreeImage interface plug-in (FreeImage.dll) was marked as missing or disabled upon program initialization.
To enable support for this image format, please copy the FreeImage.dll file (downloadable from http://freeimage.sourceforge.net/download.html) into the plug-in directory and reload the program.

phrase.translation: Stockez ne peut être menée à bien sans l'accès FreeImage Bibliothèque.

phrase.original: There is not enough memory available to continue this operation. Please free up system memory (RAM) and try again. If the problem persists, reduce the zoom value and try again.
Viewport rendering paused due to unexpected error (#%1)

There is not enough memory available to continue this operation. Please free up system memory (RAM) by shutting down unneeded programs - especially your web browser, if it is open - then try the action again.

Unfortunately, this image file appears to be invalid. This can happen if a file does not contain image data, or if it contains image data in an unsupported format.
- If you downloaded this image from the Internet, the download may have terminated prematurely. Please try downloading the image again.
- If this image file came from a digital camera, scanner, or other image editing program, it's possible that PhotoDemon simply doesn't understand this particular file format. Please save the image in a generic format (such as JPEG or PNG), then reload it.

phrase.translation: Image invalide. Chargement de l'image est annulée.

phrase.original: The specified file could not be located. If it was located on removable media, please re-insert the proper floppy disk, CD, or portable drive. If the file is not located on portable media, make sure that: 1) the file hasn't been deleted, and... 2) the file location provided to PhotoDemon is correct.

PhotoDemon cannot locate additional information for this error. That probably means this error is a bug, and it needs to be fixed!
Would you like to submit a bug report? (It takes less than one minute, and it helps everyone who uses the software.)

PhotoDemon has experienced an error. Details on the problem include:
Error number %1 Description: %2
%3

Thank you for submitting a bug report. To make sure your bug is addressed as quickly as possible, PhotoDemon needs you to answer one more question.
Do you have a GitHub account? (If you have no idea what this means, answer "No".)

PhotoDemon has automatically opened a GitHub bug report webpage for you. In the Title box, please enter the following error number with a short description of the problem: %1
Any additional details you can provide in the large text box, including the steps that led up to this error, will help it get fixed as quickly as possible.
When finished, click the Submit New Issue button. Thank you!

PhotoDemon has automatically opened a bug report webpage for you. In the Additional Details box, please describe the steps that led to this error.
In the bottom box of that page, please enter the following error number: %1
When finished, click the Submit button. Thank you!

phrase.translation: Simple routine mathématique basée sur des relations linéaires entre les pixels en diagonale.

phrase.original: colors to use (click boxes to change)
dynamically update taskbar icon to match current image

While multitasking, some find it convenient to have the PhotoDemon task bar icon reflect the image currently being edited. This option allows PhotoDemon to automatically update the task bar and window icons as necessary.
The "Recent Files" menu width is limited by Windows. To prevent this menu from overflowing, PhotoDemon can display image names only instead of full image locations.
Image windows tend to be large, so feel free to display each image's full location in the image window title bars.
remember main window's on-screen location between sessions
If selected, this setting will ensure that PhotoDemon starts up in the on-screen location where you last left it.
draw drop shadow between image and canvas
This setting helps images stand out from the canvas behind them
render PhotoDemon text with modern typefaces (only available on Vista or newer)
This setting uses "Segoe UI" as the PhotoDemon interface font. Leaving it unchecked defaults to "Tahoma".
automatically validate all incoming alpha channels

When checked, this option allows PhotoDemon to automatically remove empty alpha channels from imported images. This improves program performance, reduces RAM usage, and improves file size on exported files.
save TIFFs as separated CMYK (for printing)
TIFFs support both RGB and CMYK color spaces. RGB is used by default, but if a TIFF file is going to be used in printed document, CMYK is sometimes required.
PNG interlacing is similar to "progressive scan" on JPEGs. Interlacing slightly increases file size, but an interlaced image can "fade-in" while it downloads.
preserve file's original background color, if available
PNG files can contain a background color parameter. This takes up extra space in the file, so feel free to disable it if you don't need background colors.
when saving, compress PNG files at the following level
use RLE encoding when saving TGA images
TGA files only support one type of compression. PhotoDemon can apply simple RLE encoding when saving TGA images.
use RLE encoding when saving 8bpp BMP images
when closing image files, warn me me about unsaved changes
Check this if you want to be warned when you try to close an image with unsaved changes
save behavior: overwrite vs make a copy
when using the "Save As" command, set the default file format according to
count unique colors in incoming images (to determine optimal color depth)

This option allows PhotoDemon to scan incoming images to determine the most appropriate color depth on a case-by-case basis (rather than relying on the source image file's color depth, which may have been chosen arbitrarily).
apply tone mapping to imported HDR and RAW images (48, 64, 96, 128bpp)
Tone mapping is used to preserve the tonal range of HDR images. This setting is very useful for RAW photos and scanned documents, but it adds a significant amount of time to the image load process.
load options for specific image types
if a file contains multiple images
automatically clear the active selection after "Crop to Selection" is used

When the "Crop to Selection" command is used, the resulting image will always contain a selection the same size as the full image. There is generally no need to retain this, so PhotoDemon can automatically clear it for you.
Use this to manually disable GDI+ support. This forces PhotoDemon to rely on its FreeImage and internal VB-only routines.
Click to open a browse-for-folder dialog
log all program messages to file

If this is checked, PhotoDemon will create a human-readable .log file that contains the text of every message displayed on the progress bar. This will increase processing time, so only check this option if you really need debugging data.
memory usage will be displayed here
run-time testing options (NOTE: these are not saved to the INI file)
if core plugins cannot be located, offer to download them
phrase.translation: »« En tant que plugins de base ne peut être trouvé, proposant de télécharger '

phrase.original: PhotoDemon relies on three open-source plugins for full functionality. If they are missing, this will allow the software to automatically download them.
automatically check for software updates every 10 days
If this is disabled, you can visit tannerhelland.com/photodemon to manually download the latest version of PhotoDemon

Close the current image.
If the current image has not been saved, you will receive a prompt to save it before it closes.

Close the current image.
Because you have turned off save prompts (via Tools -> Options), you WILL NOT receive a prompt to save this image before it closes.

This action will reset all preferences to their default values. It cannot be undone.
Are you sure you want to continue?
default settings - CCITT Group 4 for 1bpp, LZW for all others
PKZIP DEFLATE (also known as zLib DEFLATE)
dynamically update taskbar icon to match current image (FreeImage plugin required)
to match the image file's original color depth
by asking me what color depth I want to use
save a new copy, e.g. "filename (2).jpg" (safe behavior)
the current file format of the image being saved
the last image format I used in the "Save As" screen
ask me how I want to proceed
load all the images in the file
render PhotoDemon text with modern typefaces
enable GDI+ support (do not enable this if gdiplus.dll is not available)
feature disabled due to missing plugin

NOTE: Some options on this page have been disabled because the FreeImage plugin is missing. To enable these options, please click on "Updates" and select "if core plugins cannot be located, offer to download them." Then restart the program and select "Yes" when prompted.
NOTE: Many of these file format options require the FreeImage plugin. Because you do not have the FreeImage plugin installed, these options may not perform as expected.
max PhotoDemon memory usage this session
Interface options include settings for the main PhotoDemon interface, including things like canvas settings, font selection, and positioning.
Load options allow you to customize the way image files enter the application.
Save options allow you to customize the way image files leave the application.
File format options control how PhotoDemon handles certain types of images.
Tool options currently include customizable options for the Selection Tool. In the future, PhotoDemon will gain paint tools, and those settings will appear here as well.
Transparency options control how PhotoDemon displays images that contain alpha channels (e.g. 32bpp images).
Update options control how frequently PhotoDemon checks for updated versions, and how it handles the download of missing plugins.
Advanced options can be safely ignored by regular users. Testers and developers may, however, find these settings useful.

PhotoDemon provides two non-essential features that require Internet access: checking for software updates, and offering to download core plugins (FreeImage, EZTwain, zLib, and pngnq-s9) if they aren't present in the \Data\Plugins subdirectory.
The developers of PhotoDemon take privacy very seriously, so no information - statistical or otherwise - is uploaded by these features. Checking for software updates involves downloading a single "updates.txt" file containing the latest software version number. Similarly, downloading missing plugins simply involves downloading one or more of the compressed plugin files from the PhotoDemon server.
If you choose to disable these features, note that you can always visit tannerhelland.com/photodemon to manually download the most recent version of the program.
WARNING: this folder is invalid (access prohibited). Please provide a valid folder. If no new folder is provided, PhotoDemon will use the system's default temp location.

phrase.original:
Unfortunately, %1 is preventing %2 from directly downloading this image. (Direct downloads are sometimes mistaken as hotlinking by misconfigured servers.)
You will need to download this image using your Internet browser of choice, then manually load it into %2.
I sincerely apologize for this inconvenience, but unfortunately there is nothing %2 can do about stingy server configurations. :(
This URL is not valid. Please make sure the URL begins with "http://" or "ftp://".
Please be respectful of copyrights when downloading images. Even if an image is available online, it may not be licensed for use outside a specific website. Thanks!
Yes. Download these files to the plugins folder.
Not right now, but please remind me later.
Not now, not ever. Do not prompt me again.
free, open-source library for optimizing portable network graphics (PNG files)

phrase.original: I understand the risks of running PhotoDemon in the IDE
You are running PhotoDemon inside the Visual Basic IDE. This is not recommended.

Please compile PhotoDemon before using it. Many features that rely on subclassing are disabled in the IDE, but some - such as custom command buttons - cannot be disabled without severely impacting the program's functionality. As such, you may experience IDE instability and crashes, especially if you close the program using the IDE's Stop button.
Additionally, like all other photo editors, PhotoDemon relies heavily on multidimensional arrays. Array performance is severely degraded in the IDE, so some functions may perform very slowly.
If you insist on running PhotoDemon in the IDE, please do not submit bugs regarding IDE crashes or freezes. PhotoDemon's developers can only address issues and bugs that affect the compiled .exe.
Use this to reset all plugin-related options to their default state. This action cannot be undone.
phrase.translation: Utilisez cette option pour toutes les options plug-in liés à leurs valeurs par défaut. Cette action ne peut pas être annulée.

phrase.original: analyze colors using YUV instead of RGB (slower, but higher quality)
phrase.translation: analyser les couleurs avec YUV au lieu de RGB (plus lent, mais de meilleure qualité)

phrase.translation: en abaissant les canaux alpha, essayez les valeurs 0 et 255 pour maintenir
